title: Clairvoyance should get a buff

I dont consider Flash to be as mandatory as many people say. It is mandatory for champions such as {{champion:90}} and {{champion:96}} who are squishy, immobile, and have no self peel. But not every champion absolutely needs Flash to the same level as those two. For example, sometimes I use Ghost/Ignite on {{champion:8}}. This is because Vlad is tanky, has self peel, sustain - so he has enough safety to forgo Flash in favor of Ghost, which actually gives him the power needed to chase some targets. Some people don't know, but one of Vladimir's main weakness is that because he has short range, it is difficult for him to stick to targets that have an higher range than him or are mobile.

Other champions that do not need Flash as much: {{champion:120}} (in fact, most people play him with Ignite/Teleport), {{champion:35}}, {{champion:77}}, and believe on me: {{champion:105}}. There may be other examples too.
People don't forgo flash on Hec because he doesn't need it, they just take ghost over it because it synergizes with him so well that it's often preferable to flash.

I take it you did not play during the first season then. 

During season 1 CV was an absolute staple for every supports because the CD was short enough to use it at the beginning of the game (see who's going where, see if they rushed to an invade, etc), where the jungler started, then when you arrived in bot lane you could toss it between the two bushes and see if someone was waiting in there for the lvl 1 cheese. 

The CD was short enough and the jungle routes predictable enough that good supports could literally make a jungler's life hell because they'd follow you around with the magical eye and open opportunities for counter jungle and/or kill gank potential.

CV was nerfed to oblivion in pre-season 2 and was never really seen since (ADC who were going flash + exhaust in S1 switched to flash + ignite while the support became the designated exhaust carrier - since then ADC have switched to flash + defensive spell, aka heal or barrier depending on which one is currently strongest, and the support has always packed their combat summoner spell of choice between exhaust and ignite).

I used to really, really love CV and even used it to be a complete bitch to the enemy by denying them the cover of bushes cross-map so they wouldn't juke my team (then my team was like "OH WOW!!" and I cried because it didn't give me assist gold), or bot lane so the enemy couldn't duke into a bush to avoid minion aggro after a poke. However, it has simply lost its place in the game with bot lanes being so fight-oriented and the ADC packing only defensive spells. The birth of the blue trinket simply was the nail in the coffin.

It's just that most  mages that would need the burst of mana will build mana regen into their items and end up with a rather lackluster summoner, endgame. It's good during laning, especially against manaless or energy champions with good waveclear.
{{summoner:13}} is really only useful early, without blue buff, midlane (mana midlaners), and without building mana regen early. That's way too many specifics to be a good summoner.

With flash being essentially mandatory in 90% of games and Riot being afraid to change it because it's too important to the game's balance, I think another solution is in order.  Give everyone Flash plus their choice of two summoner spells.  Everything can still be balanced around everyone having flash (almost everyone already does) and the other summoner spells don't need to compete with its insane versatility.
I'm sorry, are you really saying you want to play against Kallista with flash + 3 of her choices between heal, barrier, ghost, cleanse and exhaust? Because I know I fucking don't.

If it means that I get a real choice of summoner spells instead of "I'm ADC so Heal Flash" then probably. 

The biggest problem I can see with it is that it lets champions that counter each other counter harder.  As you pointed out, Kalista with Flash + Heal + Ghost / Cleanse would be very difficult to catch, so she'd make melee characters even sadder than she already does.  However, assassins jumping on her might shut her down doubly with Exhaust + Ignite, greatly reducing her ability to flee and lifesteal (might have to bait out the Cleanse if that's what she took).

Taking the game as it exists now and just throwing extra summoners on top wouldn't be balanced because some champions can benefit more from the additional spell than others.  If this happened, it would have to be part of preseason to give Riot time to rebalance the outliers.  I still think the extra possibilities it opens up could be worth it.  Summoner spells are supposed to help customize the champion to your playstyle and team composition, but the worthwhile choices are so constrained that they pretty much fail at their intended purpose.  I think making Flash free could help get them back on track.
Or let it also reveals stealth traps/champions.
CV + Oracle's Lens on the supprot = have fun playing non-Evelynn stealth champions in a teamfight brah.

Another option would be to passively increase sight radius while clairvoyance is on cooldown. 

It's weird, because it'd be the only Summoner Spell with a passive effect, but clairvoyance simply can't compete with the Farsight Orb in its current state. 

A similar treatment could be given to Clarity and Barrier as well (though I can't think of what to do with barrier. After heal was buffed, it kinda fell out of use.)
